mediaList.caption: A fried eggs dish is the best bet
The staff couldn't be bothered to clear the table
Terras met uitzicht op de bossen.
Fried eggs with bacon and then a 'Ossche Bol" as dessert
Fried eggs with bacon and then a 'Ossche Bol" as dessert

reviews.title: Good experience
reviews.text: Nice service, longer waiting time, good food, prices were okay for the Netherlands, the potion sizes were very good, nice location

reviews.title: Setting great, food average
reviews.text: The location is beautiful. In the middle of the fantastic forests of the Veluwe. That's the biggest plus of this restaurant. The service was very friendly this time (we experienced that differently). The pancakes and poffertjes are fine, but if you look at the price, I would expect larger portions and also a larger pancake. Easy money is made here is my impression. Nevertheless, had a pleasant lunch here. If you want a ‘normal’ tasty pancake during a walk or bike ride in this area, you’ve come to the right place. Also plenty of place on the terrace.

reviews.title: Relaxation sought and found
reviews.text: Welcoming received, clear explanation about this deal, also about the possible extra possibilities at extra cost. Chosen for the Oxstall soup, it was delicious. Plenty of choice for the topping on your pancake, and a delicious sorbet to finish. The person in front of our ministry clearly felt like his profession. Topper

reviews.title: Top
reviews.text: Great food, nice location and friendly service. It's in the middle of the woods. As a result, you have to drive on unspoilt roads with potholes, but the atmosphere makes up for it there. Would definitely eat here more often.

reviews.title: Nice and tasty
reviews.text: Beautiful location in the forest, accessible by a dirt road, atmospheric and delicious food. Friendly service and plenty of free parking

reviews.title: Delicious lunch
reviews.text: Cozy place we had a lovely lunch. Very friendly service we felt welcome. It's worth repeating.

reviews.title: Beautiful location for patient people
reviews.text: Nice place but that's all said. Service does its best but it takes an awful long time to get your order. Waiting 45 minutes for a simple pancake? You could really do better.

reviews.title: Unnecessarily long wait
reviews.text:
We have had a very disappointed experience.
》They couldn't handle the fall break rush《
• waiting too long for food
• lousy servers
• got another dish

tips.body: Je moet er geduld voor hebben

reviews.title: See you again!!!
reviews.text:
A turn-off!
For 4 pancakes with apples and 4 (half) bags of lukewarm chocolate paid 64€.                   
If the pancakes were still good, you might still accept this. 
See you again!!!

reviews.title: Too bad.
reviews.text:
We entered, outside it was blowing us too hard now half past 7 29 Aug. Inside all doors were open in t around the tours enormous. I said to a waitress who saw us go out, yes t draft right in.
Okay, she said. But in the end we went to Epe the Honeypot where we were wonderfully cozy.  And very good food.
Too bad about the visit which therefore did not happen. But how the food is we do not know.but vd rest t is nice. But no too big too busy. Not atmospheric.

reviews.title: Why are we here again
reviews.text: As I have awarded 'De Ossenstal' a two point rating a second time in a row, a question may be raised: why were you there. Face the facts. De Ossenstal is reached through an unpaved road, worse in repair every following year, playing havoc with the suspension of the car, food is mediocre and the prices are eye-watering. Furthermore, most of the staff give the impression, that they do not like their job; there is no welcoming atmosphere in this restaurant. But I must say, at an outdoor table in the middle of the woods it is relaxing. Furthermore, visiting De Ossenstal is a bit 'Down Memory Lane': lunch at De Ossenstal when on holiday in the neighbourhood is almost inevitable for us.

photo.caption: A fried eggs dish is the best bet

reviews.title: Unwell
reviews.text:
During dinner my wife became unwell got a faint, which was responded well by the staff.
Ambulance arrived soon.
However, there was a lack of emergency response, a stretcher and a space to realize. 
It would be good to study the rules of the Health and Safety Act and the rules of Horeca Nederland.

reviews.title: Good food and a good atmosphere. Nice staff, strange that there is alcohol in the children's dessert
reviews.text:
Had dinner here with five adults. The access road to the restaurant is very poor, with large potholes in the road surface. It is important to drive slowly and pay close attention.

On a Saturday night at 17:05 we ordered drinks and appetizers, which were served within minutes. We had a loaf of broken bread and a portion of nachos, both of good portions and good taste.

At 17:20 we ordered our main courses: four pancakes and a hamburger. By 18:15 we still had no food, but at 18:25 everything was finally served. The burger was delicious, although the sandwich was very dry and crumbled a bit. The fries were delicious and the pancakes tasted good too.

Before dessert I felt pretty full, so I ordered a children's ice cream, because it's not that big and it would come with a lollipop. When dessert came, however, it was much bigger than expected, with two scoops of vanilla ice cream, whipped cream and a cookie. Halfway through the ice cream I suddenly tasted lawyer, which I find very strange and inappropriate for a children's ice cream. There was also no lollipop as indicated on the menu card.

When I checked out I asked for the lollipop and it turned out that they had made an 'adult' children's ice cream. I could still get a lollipop when I asked for it.

Overall we ate well but the prices were on the high side. It was very busy and making contact with the waitress was not always smooth. 

Seems better to me if someone ordered a children's ice cream and then asked if it should be a children's portion or an adult portion. And certainly ask if alcohol/lawyer should be included.

Staff were very friendly.

tips.body: Let op dat de toegangsweg slecht is. Erg hobbelige zandweg met diepe kuilen.

reviews.title: Good to be there and good food.
reviews.text:
Ribeye eaten: fine. Really not too salty, as others say. Ambience also OK.
In short, this wasn't the first visit and I don't expect it to be the last.

reviews.title: Review
reviews.text: Nice restaurant but bit pricey. Especially long waiting times. For the rest it is fine here and also a nice playground for the kids.

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

tripContent.title: Experience vibrant art and culture in Fort Myers
tripContent.description: There’s so much more to soak up than the sun in and around Fort Myers. This itinerary is designed for art-lovers, who can take in the visual and performing arts scene, learn about the area’s fascinating history, and go for a scenic stroll to enjoy neighborhood murals and outdoor art installations.

articleContent.title: Your family-friendly guide to Greenville, SC

seoInfo.metaDescription: Picnics, waterparks, museums, festivals, and plenty of unexpected all-ages activities—the equation for the perfect family getaway can be tough to balance. But there’s one place that does just this, promising plenty of memories to pack along with the souvenirs. Greenville, South Carolina checks all of the boxes, from hotels with plenty of family-friendly amenities to museums with interactive exhibits that’ll hold everyone’s attention (even a rambunctious toddler). Those in charge of packing can breathe easy: the weather is great year-round—the hottest month is July with temps up to 89 degrees, and the coolest is January, when the high hits around 55 degrees.
How to make the most of 24 hours in Krakow from exploring the Jewish quarter of Kazimierz to eating Polish classics and more.

seoInfo.metaDescription: Well-tested guidance and trip inspo from our community.
From studio tours to live music joints, here's where to find soul music's past and present.

seoInfo.metaDescription: How to make the most of three days in Majorca from exploring seaside villages to the best seafood restaurants to epic views and more.

reviews.title: Little improvement
reviews.text:
Tried our Ossenstal pancake again.
Wrong table chosen, table next to us and waiters had a discussion throughout the restaurant. Service was not very customer friendly anyway.
Also think that more turnover can be achieved if the guests are asked again when the food is delivered if they want something to drink.
We had to wait 45 minutes after we ordered.
My son had chosen the pancake with cheese, it seemed like an entire bag had been emptied of it. Too bad it wasn't put under the grill or something so that the cheese had melted a bit.
The same applied to the cold apple compote with my pancake. It would have been nice warm. Fortunately without currants.

reviews.title: Shame!
reviews.text:
We went here because of our grandson so he could play a bit.
The weather was nice so it was very busy.
I wanted to order satay with bread and I asked if it could be done with white bread. I was told by the employee that they only have brown bread (I cannot tolerate this). I spoke to someone from management and I was told that they don't have such a big kitchen... and I should have called to ask if they served white bread, I had lunch many times but I never heard this nonsense and I just had to enjoy my appetizers, yes I think so tasty around 3 o'clock but not for lunch.
Also had to wait a very long time and there is no overview.
Very young staff and they have to divide the areas so that they don't have to keep asking if you have been helped yet.
This was a one-off for me!

reviews.title: Again very mediocre.
reviews.text: Because we had an invitation for a birthday, we took the plunge again and went to the ox stable. Our previous experience was not very positive but okay. Everyone deserves a 2nd chance. Because I didn't really like the burger last time, I opted for the hare satay with fries and my wife with bread. We know for sure now. We won't be coming back here again. Honestly...the meat was fine, but dry tjampoer and unbaked bread? Come on. And then say with dry eyes that the bread should be like that. Besides, there is little the management can do about it. Too young and too inexperienced. Nice challenge for the restaurant manager to ensure that he/she strives for a slightly higher level.

reviews.title: Price/quality not okay
reviews.text:
When we arrived we thought, fortunately there were only a few people, so we had another appointment afterwards.
We were helped quickly, the starter was also delivered quickly, and we also ordered the pancakes right away, unfortunately it took 45 minutes before they arrived. In the meantime, there have been 4 people who asked if we wanted something to drink, but they did not respond well to each other.
Pancakes weren't really tasty.
Very expensive restaurant, won't go there again

reviews.title: Not a pleasant experience in terms of hospitality
reviews.text: Service was not customer friendly and few came to the table for drinks. Pancakes were of mediocre quality and half warm

reviews.title: Not worth a sequel.
reviews.text: Our daughter turned 16 and in honor of her grandmother who always stopped at the Ossenstal for our daughter after a walk, we chose this restaurant. The problem is that so much is wrong that it is difficult to prioritize. But okay. The way to the restaurant is a big challenge. A bad road with many potholes awaits you. This may not be so bad in the summer, but in the rainy season you will be walking on ice. Standing in water up to my ankles is not a nice start to your evening. The decor is old-fashioned and radiates from the 1930s. That rhymes with the ministry. The staff is too young and really doesn't understand anything about catering. Old gin is berry gin and they have never heard of medium sherry. Furthermore, the wine arrangement is of a questionable level, but not surprising if this is not a core business. And then the food. The pancakes are okay, but the hamburgers are a big disaster. Stale bread and minimal meat are masked with bacon to distract you a bit. Last but not least, our desserts were quickly removed from the table because no one was sitting there. All in all a great feeling. Paid a lot of money but for very poor quality.

reviews.title: Bad experience.
reviews.text: We were here last Saturday evening, September 16, with a group of 18 adults and 8 children. It was on the occasion of a family day. Unfortunately it took an hour and a half for the first pancakes to arrive. For our grandchildren ranging in age from 6 months to 8 years, it took way too long, despite the nice play equipment. When the delicious pancakes were eaten, our drink was served as mustard after the meal. We would have liked to have another dessert, but the table was cleared and no waiter asked. And given the speed of serving, we left it at that. At checkout we were charged no less than 274 euros too much. The bill for the party next to us was on us. Fortunately, we always check accounts properly and the error was corrected. But all in all, we did not think our visit to the ox stable was a great success.

reviews.title: hygiene was very poor
reviews.text: the pancakes were delicious, the condition was mediocre, the order for an extra drink did not arrive. The table was not clean and was not cleaned, the plate was put on the dirty table without a placemat, the toilet was a disaster

reviews.title: The wreckage of a once attractive restaurant
reviews.text: I will make this review as short as possible, because I still get hot under the collar when I think back at this experience. Restaurant "De Ossenstal" was always an anchor point for a pleasant lunch when on holiday on "De Veluwe". But this time it was different: Service of the staff: almost non existent. Waiting times: of Biblical proportions (although it was not busy that day). My food: lukewarm, almost cold when served. Prices of food and drinks: extortionate, even for Dutch standards. Paying the bill and coming away: I had to telephone the restaurant on my cell phone and threaten to leave without paying, only then the staff went in search for a device accepting my bank card. You guessed right. There was no tip and it will be a long while before I try the Ossenstal again.

photo.caption: The staff couldn't be bothered to clear the table

reviews.title: Indifferent service
reviews.text: When I was sitting in the outdoor area of the famous pancake restaurant "De Ossenstal", the thought occurred to me that this restaurant would be an ideal spot to try robots for waiters; the customers wouldn't notice. Service was indeed indifferent and robotic. Furthermore, when the waiting time for our food approached Biblical proportions, a presumably person in charge came to our table to apologize, because in the kitchen they couldn't get the signature "Ossenstal" pancake right. This pancake, my travel companion ordered, was the mainstay of this restaurant decades ago, when the restaurant still was situated in the original farm house. (Burned down to the ground years ago). After some more waiting time the signature pancake appeared (hurray) on the table. I  suspect they had to dig up a dusty case from a spider infested cellar and get from this case a roll of parchment with the correct ancient recipe. The pancake was delicious I gather from my travel  companion and my fried egg dish I devoured to the last crumb, so all was not lost and "De Ossenstal" screeched home with a three point rating. A further positive point is the generous parking lot opposite the restaurant.

photo.caption: Fried eggs with bacon and then a 'Ossche Bol" as dessert
Fried eggs with bacon and then a 'Ossche Bol" as dessert

reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
reviews.text: Some years ago I visited "De Ossenstal" using a discounted voucher. I was then a bit disappointed at the mediocre food and the complete lack of hospitality. Hoping for a better experience I had planned a visit with family this time, because of a short vacation in the neighbourhood and glorious weather. A pleasant surprise was this late lunch visit. The weather was glorious as mentioned, the food was well prepared, the tables in the outside seating area, which we preferred, had a good distance to each other according to the corona rules and most important, the service of the staff was impeccably hospitable and prompt. A well earned four point rating.  Ample parking is available across the road. When I write road I must mention that you don't need a four wheel drive to reach the Ossenstal, but the Ossenweg is an unpaved road all the same.

reviews.title: Oasis in the forest
reviews.text: Looking for a place to rest during your family forest walk with kids? This is the place to be! Great outdoor seating with view on the large playground, friendly services and delicious pancakes, burgers, salads and more.

reviews.title: quick pancake dinner
reviews.text: Nice kid friendly resultant pancakes are the main item but the other dishes are equally  yummy as well.

reviews.title: Pancakes in a beautiful setting
reviews.text:
This is the place to go if you are up and about on the Veluwe. Have a cup of coffee and order some poffertjes to go with it. Order a pancake, I'm sure you are going to like it.

We had the special thick, crumbly pancake they only make in the Ossenstal. Great first bite but it is so "machtig" (filling!!) the each subsequent bite is less and less appealing. Next time it'll be regular pancake with "spek" for me.

The one thing that's confusing for us "Murricans" is the service. Not only do you have multiple waitresses assigned to one table, they are working at a European pace. Let's just say there's a lot of waiting in between ordering and someone checking up on your table. Don't forget it is not customary in Europe to slap the bill on the table while you are eating, you will have to ask for it. 

Anyhoo. Good food, lot's of waiting a bit drafty and cold inside.

reviews.title: Very nice burgers
reviews.text: We ate here with 12 persons and we got warm food all at once. They know how to serve large groups. The special beers were rather nice and the price was reasonable.

reviews.title: Super High Tea
reviews.text:
We had a superb high tea with 11 adults and 8 children. The children were very fond of the mini pancakes.

The children could also play to their heart’s content on the playing grounds next to the restaurants and the woods while the adults could still see them.

reviews.title: Ideally located
reviews.text: The location is definitely the main asset of this place. In the wood, it is a perfect starting point for a day walk and the view of the surroundings is really pleasant. The meals are big. They mainly do pancakes but they have a lot of other choices. We had goat cheese salad, farmer's eggs and a Greek pancake (the ingredients are cooked inside the paste, not served on top). That was very good. The staff is casual and friendly. Perfect for lunch.

reviews.title: A hidden gem of pancake heaven
reviews.text:
We were staying in a hotel just north of Epe and discovered a hidden gem of a pancake house. De Ossenstal is situated in the middle of the forest just off the north end of Dellenweg. 

Its a sanding track in by car, but you can get there by foot or bike along a mile long path though the woods, starting at the Fletcher Hotel. 

The choice of pancakes and other foods of course is wide and varied. We ate there a few times as the teenagers loved the pancakes. 

we went there for an evening meal too. Ribs, steaks, pizzas.......great selection. 

Go, if you love pancakes.

photo.caption: The Long Walk Through the Woods

reviews.title: A hidden Gem in the middle of the forest
reviews.text:
Went to this restaurant on a busy August evening with my parents and grandparents. We had made a reservation and had learned ahead of time that it would be very busy. Upon our arrival this was confirmed since almost every table had people that were enjoying their meal. 
After taking our seat we had to wait a bit to place an order for our drinks. Once we got our drinks we would have been able to place our food order but did not get a chance to do so. We had a slightly long wait to order our food which once ordered did come rather quickly. All of us had ordered pancakes with different toppings. 
I had the Pizza Pancake which was richly covered in tomato-sauce, salami and cheese and tasted amazing. The Noorse pancakes was covered in fresh smoked salmon and had tuna and prawns in the pancake self. The Stroopwafel pancakes did look amazing with stroopwafels in the dough and a topping of caramel sauce and whipped cream. The Veluwse pancake was a very heavy pancake with bacon, onion and egg in it but never the less was it delicious. 
Unfortunately were the dessert slightly bigger than our appetites but the taste was amazing.
Overall the visit was very nice. However in the opinion of someone who works as a waitress the service could have been a little bit better.

reviews.title: a very special place
Super location in the nature
reviews.text: Origanal a pancake restaurant but now more and better that. Ideal t stay here after a wonderfull walk is the surrounding or passing by after a bike trip....

reviews.title: Good place for pancakes
reviews.text: This restaurant is situated in the wood, and has a nice terrace outside. It is a good place to start for a walk and end with a soup or pancake. Lunch is okay too.

reviews.title: A simple and OK "foodbarn" on a unique spot in the forest
reviews.text:
The location and building of this "kids with family" attractive location in the middle of a beautiful forestry is more attempting than the foodoffering.

The smiling and pleasant staff however makes you feel happy, the service is fast and smoothless.

Combine the visit on  a sunny weekend\day for a nice stroll in the Veluwe woods and accept that not  all restaurants need to have a mIchelin star. The terrcae is great and makes you feel more relaxed than an expensive evening in a wellness :).

PS. Your kids will love "Ossenstal-pancakes". They are truly great in selection and taste.

reviews.title: One of the best pancakes I ever had!
reviews.text:
In the forest of Epe (the Netherlands) is a restaurant " De Ossenstal" that bake price winning pancakes (pannenkoeken). There is also a play yard for children. The service is great and very friendly. Dogs and their owners are welcome too.

It is a wonderful place!

Yolanda Kuiperij.

reviews.title: Ossenstal, stay with your roots: Pancakes
reviews.text: Restaurant "De Ossenstal" has its roots in a heritage farmhouse in the woods close to the village Epe. In this farmhouse a well known pancake restaurant was situated. (Hence the name, Oxen Stable). Unfortunately, around thirty years ago the original restaurant burned down completely (no wonder, the farmhouse was constructed mainly from inflammable material such as wood and thatch). Later, on this site, a brand new pavilion was erected in wood and glass, continuing the name "De Ossenstal". In this restaurant, not only pancakes are served, but also three course meals from the menu can be ordered. We had obtained a discounted voucher for a three course meal. About the quality of the food I will not dwell; I will remark only that the main ingredient of the soup and the sauce, served with the fish, is water and that was painfully clear in the food served. The service was forced friendly, not uncommon in a Dutch restaurant, but what was unforgivable in terms of hospitality, that the waitress started to lay out our table for a later reservation, while we still were at our second course. Reflecting, that our table was pointed out to us by the staff, the irritation increased further. What "De Ossenstal" does very well is serving pancakes to a family with small children. So, when you are in the woods around Epe, walking or biking, and you feel a bit peckish, there is no harm to go to "De Ossenstal" and choose a pancake; you will get value for money. But I can't recommend "De Ossenstal" as a place to sit down for a three course meal. Restaurant "De Ossenstal should return to its roots and revert to "pancakes only".
